subject: Law
title: Probation and Parole
description: A quick win: understand Probation and Parole.

hook.text: A convicted felon walks freeâ€”but with rules, check-ins, and the threat of prison hanging over every step.

buildup.text: Probation is served instead of prison. Parole is supervised release after serving part of a prison sentence.

discovery.text: Both require conditions: regular meetings with officers, drug tests, curfews, and staying out of trouble.

twist.text: Violating conditions can send you straight to prisonâ€”sometimes for the full original sentence.

climax.text: Probation and parole save prison costs and help reintegrate offenders, but supervision resources are stretched thin.

punchline.text: Freedom with conditions. Break them and freedom disappears.

quiz.question: What is the difference between probation and parole?
options: Probation replaces prison; parole follows prison time
